solution_line_template: The coach has {initial_liters} liters * {ml_per_liter} ml/liter = <<{initial_liters}*{ml_per_liter}={initial_ml_water}>>{initial_ml_water} ml of water.
She pours {ml_per_player} ml/player x {num_players} players = <<{ml_per_player}*{num_players}={total_poured_ml}>>{total_poured_ml} ml of water in total for all the athletes.
The water spill means {total_poured_ml} ml + {spilled_ml} ml = <<{total_poured_ml}+{spilled_ml}={total_water_used}>>{total_water_used} ml of water was used.
There was {initial_ml_water} ml - {total_water_used} ml = <<{initial_ml_water}-{total_water_used}={water_left_over}>>{water_left_over} ml of water left.
